intro: Withania subtriflora, commonly known as the Indian winter cherry, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and red, berry-like fruits that mature in the winter season. It is often found in dry, rocky soils and thrives in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
